name: Heimlich Maneuver
warning: Only use if person cannot cough, speak, or breathe. For severe choking only.
emergency_notes: If person becomes unconscious, start CPR
Never perform on infants under 1 year

steps.title: Assess the Situation
steps.description: Ask 'Are you choking?' Look for signs
detailed_instructions: Ask the person if they're choking
Look for inability to speak or cough
Check if they're clutching their throat
Confirm they cannot breathe
steps.voice_prompt: Ask the person if they are choking. Look for signs like inability to speak, cough, or breathe.
steps.critical_warning: Only proceed if person cannot cough or speak

steps.title: Position Yourself
detailed_instructions: Stand directly behind the choking person
Wrap your arms around their waist
Position yourself slightly to the side
Make sure they're standing or sitting upright
steps.voice_prompt: Stand behind the person and wrap your arms around their waist.

steps.title: Make a Fist
detailed_instructions: Make a fist with one hand
Place thumb side against abdomen
Position fist just above the navel
Position below the ribcage
steps.voice_prompt: Make a fist with one hand. Place it just above the navel, below the ribcage.

steps.title: Perform Thrusts
detailed_instructions: Grasp fist with your other hand
Give quick, upward thrusts
Thrust inward and upward
Use significant force
Perform 5 thrusts
steps.voice_prompt: Grasp your fist with your other hand. Give five quick, upward thrusts into the abdomen.

steps.title: Check and Repeat
detailed_instructions: Check if the person can breathe
Ask if they can speak
If still choking, repeat thrusts
Continue until object is dislodged
If person becomes unconscious, start CPR
steps.voice_prompt: Check if the person can breathe or speak. If still choking, repeat the thrusts. Continue until the object is dislodged or person becomes unconscious.
